timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we do the same thing than above in the code (ie: using Objects.equals)?

replies.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText:
Ok,
Shouldn't we use compare in the equals then?
replies.author: kevinleturc

replies.bodyText: Perhaps yes, I should confess that I didn't to want to change the  exiting code not related directly to this ticket
replies.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText: Hum, I would say more or less because you don't use the same way to compare the dates. I would say we should use the same way to compare them or if there's a reason, let's put it in a comment, wdyt?
replies.author: kevinleturc

replies.bodyText: to do the correct thing, let aligne the equals to use the compare like i did and like it's done on low level. I think i will use the same commit, i mean it's really a minor change to separate it into a specific commit wdyt ?
replies.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText: I think you can use the same commit, it would make sense to have it next to compare introduction you're doing 👍.
